metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16119 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel exploitable by a local attacker due to reuse of a DCCP socket with an attached dccps_hc_tx_ccid object as a listener after being released. Fixed in Ubuntu Linux kernel 5.4.0-51.56, 5.3.0-68.63, 4.15.0-121.123, 4.4.0-193.224, 3.13.0.182.191 and 3.2.0-149.196. Hadar Manor discovered that the DCCP protocol implementation in the Linux kernel improperly handled socket reuse, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-121-generic - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-4.15.0-121-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-4.15.0-121-lowlatency - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-121-generic - 4.15.0-121.123
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-121-lowlatency - 4.15.0-121.123
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> patch applied to the ubuntu-kernels was NACKed by upstream. The subsequent revision submitted upstream still needs rework and has not been accepted as of 2021-01-13.

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-121.123').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1086.91').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
